instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_PWM: What is LCD_BKLT_PWM? LCD_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> is missing after a GPU reflow
threads.message: When we short <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> to a 3.4v source then we have backlight, any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> is missing after a GPU reflow
threads.message:
Oooops, never do that again.
Some signals are controlled by Open-Drain circuits; doing that you can fry it...
Use pull-up resistor for such test and disconect signal from its control circuit.
In your case, remove <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> and connect <CAPACITOR>C9704</CAPACITOR> with <CAPACITOR>C9723</CAPACITOR>; only pads are there.
This is a short fix; no backlight control anymore.
But you didn't specify if image is present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> is missing after a GPU reflow
threads.message:
image is present and everything's working, we need a solution that also includes the display backlight being controllable. 

Arash

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> is missing after a GPU reflow
threads.message: Your original problem was probably <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>, which will happen again once the cap has cooled down. Either the GPU got fried or <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>. My vote is on <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>. Did you cover over this with a lot of kapton/aluminum tape during reflow of GPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> is missing after a GPU reflow
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> was fine, Yes GMUX was properly protected, we will change the GPU, let's see.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> is missing after a GPU reflow
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> is never fine, it's the first thing you change on a 2850.
